abstract_sentences.1: Video captioning, the task of describing the content of a video, has seen some promising improvements in recent years with sequence-to-sequence models, but accurately learning the temporal and logical dynamics involved in the task still remains a challenge, especially given the lack of sufficient annotated data.
abstract_sentences.2: We improve video captioning by sharing knowledge with two related directed-generation tasks: a temporally-directed unsupervised video prediction task to learn richer context-aware video encoder representations, and a logically-directed language entailment generation task to learn better video-entailing caption decoder representations.
abstract_sentences.3: For this, we present a many-to-many multi-task learning model that shares parameters across the encoders and decoders of the three tasks.
abstract_sentences.4: We achieve significant improvements and the new state-of-the-art on several standard video captioning datasets using diverse automatic and human evaluations.
abstract_sentences.5: We also show mutual multi-task improvements on the entailment generation task.

body_sentences.24: 2 Related Work  Early video captioning work (Guadarrama et al., 2013; Thomason et al., 2014; Huang et al., 2013) used a two-stage pipeline to first extract a subject, verb, and object (S,V,O) triple and then generate a sentence based on it.

body_sentences.37: (2016)’s hierarchical RNN generates sentences at the first level and the second level captures inter-sentence dependencies in a paragraph.
body_sentences.39: (2016b) proposed to simultaneously learn the RNN word probabilities and a visual-semantic joint embedding space that enforces the relationship between the semantics of the entire sentence and the visual content.
body_sentences.40: Despite these useful recent improvements, video captioning still suffers from limited supervision and generalization capabilities, esp.
body_sentences.41: given the complex action-based temporal and story-based logical dynamics that need to be captured from short video clips.
body_sentences.42: Our work addresses this issue by bringing in complementary temporal and logical knowledge from video prediction and textual entailment generation tasks (respectively), and training them together via many-to-many multi-task learning.
body_sentences.43: Multi-task learning is a useful learning paradigm to improve the supervision and the generalization performance of a task by jointly training it with related tasks (Caruana, 1998; Argyriou et al., 2007; Kumar and Daumé III, 2012).

body_sentences.202: 6 Conclusion  We presented a multimodal, multi-task learning approach to improve video captioning by incorporating temporally and logically directed knowledge via video prediction and entailment generation tasks.
body_sentences.203: We achieve the best reported results (and rank) on three datasets, based on multiple automatic and human evaluations.
body_sentences.204: We also show mutual multi-task improvements on the new entailment generation task.
body_sentences.205: In future work, we are applying our entailment-based multi-task paradigm to other directed language generation tasks such as image captioning and document summarization.
